title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 833.9 - Informal conferences and emergencies
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 833.9 - Informal conferences and emergencies

State Regulations
(a) Whenever the executive director shall
deem necessary, or upon request of the applicant, an informal conference may be
scheduled to explain, supplement or review an application. (b) In the event of an emergency requiring
immediate action to protect the public interest or to avoid substantial and
irreparable injury to any private person or property, and the circumstances do
not permit a review, hearing and determination in the regular course of these
regulations, the executive director with the approval of the chairman of the
commission may issue an emergency certificate authorizing an applicant to take
such action as the executive director may deem necessary and proper in the
circumstances, pending review, hearing and determination by the commission as
otherwise required in this Subchapter. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
833.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
